newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Mosel says October profit falls.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Mosel says October profit falls.

text.p: Taiwan semiconductor maker Mosel Vitelic Inc said on Tuesday its net profit in October fell to T$276 million compared with T$830 million in October 1995.
Mosel said in a statement that sales revenue in October was down to T$920 million from T$1.59 billion a year ago.
Its combined net profit for the first 10 months in 1996 was T$3.57 billion, down from T$5.78 billion in the same 1995 period.
Sales revenue from January to October fell to T$9.09 billion from T$11.21 billion in the corresponding 1995 period.
Mosel, one of Taiwan's top chipmakers, has attributed its earnings squeeze to falling prices of its main product, dynamic random-access memory chips, since early 1996.
